column2: Celtic paganism is the last remaining holdover of a rich culture that long ago spread across most of Europe. Once animistic, the current pantheon of gods originates in the most respected part of nature: water, forests, and wildlife. Syncretion with urban civilizations anthropomorphised many spirits into their current form. Most commonly worshipped are Dagdae, the Great God, Mórrigan, the Phantom Queen, Óengus, Son of the Young, Lugh of the Long Arm, and Manandán, Son of the Sea.

Druids have etched sacred writings on many raised stones on their islands, recounting the story of the Tuatha Dé Danann. Bards have put the faith's history into song, allowing all to partake in its revival.

column2: As we move forward into a new age for the Celtic faith we must look to the spirits of nature for guidance. The power of prophecy will shine a light on an uncertain future.
Rulers follow the Celtic principles of animism and haruspicy
column3: Les seigneurs suivent les principes celtique de l'animisme et de l'haruspicine
column4: Herrscher folgen den keltischen Prinzipien des Animusmus und Wahrsagertum
column6: Los gobernantes siguen los principios célticos de animismo y aruspicina

column2: Money in the Campaign Fund will increase your influence with the Circle and make your candidate more likely to be elected the next Senior Druid. You can freely adjust the amount until the next Senior Druid is elected, when the Fund will be used up in the election campaign.
column3: L'argent du fonds de campagne sert à accroître l'influence d'un candidat auprès du Cercle et ainsi augmenter ses chances d'être élu Druide Senior. Vous pouvez ajuster librement ce montant jusqu'à l'élection du prochain Druide Senior, moment auquel votre fonds de campagne sera intégralement utilisé.
column4: Das Geld in der Wahlkampfkasse steigert Euren Einfluss beim Kreis, sodass Euer Kandidat bessere Chancen auf die Wahl zum Chef-Druide hat. Ihr könnt den Betrag bis zum Zeitpunkt, an dem der Chef-Druide gewählt wird, frei verändern. Bei der Wahl wird der Betrag verbraucht.
column6: El dinero del Fondo para la campaña aumenta vuestra influencia con el Circulo y aumenta las probabilidades de que vuestro candidato sea elegido el próximo Druida Mayor. Podéis ajustar libremente la cantidad hasta que se elija al próximo Druida Mayor, cuando se invertirá el Fondo en la campaña de electoral.

column2: Vasconic paganism was the religion of many tribes centered around Northeast Iberia and Southwest France which predate Europeans, but now only has adherents among the Basque people. Vasconic paganism is known for its matriarchical structure
column3: women are the primary priests of the religion. The main figure of worship is Mari, mother goddess of the earth, and her consort Sugaar, snake god of thunder.

column2: After many sacrifices to the Gods, the sorginak have seen signs in their divinations. The Euskara religion is revived, and ready to defend against false gods old and new.
Rulers follow the Vasconic principles of sacrifice and syncretism.
column3: Les seigneurs suivent les principes vasconiques de sacrifice et de syncrétisme.
column4: Herrscher folgen den vaskonischen Prinzipien von Opferbereitschaft und Synkretismus.
column6: Los gobernantes siguen los principios vasconicos de sacrificio y sincretismo.

column4: Das heilige Zepter der Hohen Sorgin, dem Oberhaupt des Euskara-Glaubens.
column6: El cetro sagrado sostenido por la Gran Sorgin, jefe de la fe Euskara.

column2: Expelled the Sword of Ama Lur

Gnyan'po Cho'ga, or 'Sacred Rites', are the Tibetan pre-Buddhism shamanist beliefs. Tibetan shamanism believes in a three-levelled cosmos. The top level, home of benevolent gods, the middle level that is home to the sibda or 'lords of the soil' as well as the spirits of the dead and mortals and finally the lower level, the home of the snake gods.\nSymbolically a ladder or rope connects the middle and top levels of this cosmos together. The kings of these realms were considered divine and when their mortal body would die a complex burial ritual was completed to allow their soul to ascend the upper levels via this rope.\nOver time many of the traditions of this pagan belief system would become incorporated into the Tibetan variant of Buddhism, Bön.

Bön is the Tibetan religion that arose from the amalgamation of ancient Tibetan beliefs and Indian Buddhism that had been sponsored in the 7th century in Tibet. While very similar in many ways to Buddhism this complex history allowed it to retain many of its ancient shamanistic beliefs and traditions that make it distinct to Indian Buddhism.\n
